features: Johnson & Johnson First Aid Kit To Go -- Pack of 3 Kits. Includes Essential First Aid Items.
The perfect first aid kit for car, purse, office, gym and more. Durable plastic case with 12 items -- hand cleansing wipes, gauze pads and two sizes of Band-Aids.
Always be prepared with these travel first aid kits by Johnson & Johnson. Fit in any glove box, cabinet or purse.
This mini kit is perfect for minor first aid situations.
Pack of 3 -- enough for home, car and office.
body.description: Be a mini-hero wherever you go with this handy 3-pack of Johnson & Johnson First Aid Kits! Tuck one in your car, office, and purse for ultimate on-the-go preparedness. These compact kits (think pocket-sized!) boast essential supplies for cuts, scrapes, burns, and minor mishaps, so you're always ready to handle life's little bumps. Don't let small emergencies slow you down – grab a kit, stay calm, and conquer the day! 3-pack includes adhesive bandages, antiseptic wipes, gauze pads, and more - simple to use, even in a rush. Peace of mind in a tiny package, Johnson & Johnson First Aid Kits, your small but mighty allies for every adventure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect size for travel
reviews.reviewText: I got these to include in a personal ziplock bag of items for each of us on a recent trip. They are lightweight, and easy to pack. Although they are not a fullblown first aid kit, they are great for a backpack or purse, when you just need a bandaid. I can't tell you how many times I've heard "Mom (or grandma), do you have a bandaid?" Now each child grandchild has their own little box. It's plastic and the lid snaps on tightly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These have the essentials for minor cuts and is the perfect size for any vehicle. It fits great in your door or in your middle console. Container is well made and will last a long time. Only will have to refill when needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to store in cars and backpacks
reviews.reviewText: I have one of these kits in my purse, backpacks and car and also used them for stocking stuffers. They are a huge hut with kids and parents alike as a small gift. The size and container works well for daily use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice little kit.
reviews.reviewText: I gave these to my girls and granddaughter for their cars. I have one. They are perfect. You never know when you might need it. Great price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Just what I needed
reviews.reviewText: One in the bathroom, and one in each car.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect travel size!
reviews.reviewText: My kids are obsessed with bandaids for their boo boos! So I ordered these, added extra bandaids to it, and put one in every vehicle we have! It really is a lifesaver and doesn’t take up a lot of space like most first aid kits!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Work good as nipple covers
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Also work on cuts I guess

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Classroom Doctor Kit
reviews.reviewText: One of my classroom jobs is "Doctor". Instead of students coming up to me anytime they need a bandaid or ice pack for small things they go to the class doctor (they still come to me if they are sick or have a big problem). I invested in these small first aid kits to hold band-aids and the doctor/s have them strategically placed around the classroom so they can easily get to them. Students love taking ownership of helping a friend while being the doctor. These containers came with a few bandaids and other supplies, we only keep bandaids in them and refill as needed.
